definitions: hard, strong, gray or bluish-gray alloy of iron with carbon and other elements
examples: The bridge was constructed using reinforced steel beams for extra strength
Stainless steel is commonly used for kitchen utensils and appliances

definitions: machine that supplies motive power for a vehicle or other device with moving parts
examples: The electric motor powers the conveyor belt in the factory
Check the motor oil regularly to keep your car running smoothly

definitions: business or company, especially one involving financial risk
project or undertaking, typically one that is difficult or requires effort
examples: She started a small enterprise selling handmade jewelry online
The software enterprise has grown to employ thousands of people worldwide
The Arctic expedition was a dangerous enterprise requiring careful planning
Building the canal was an ambitious enterprise that took years to complete

definitions: fixed regular payment, typically paid monthly, made by employer to employee for work
examples: Her annual salary increased by ten percent after the promotion
The company offers competitive salaries and excellent benefits to attract talent

definitions: child of one's uncle or aunt, sharing common grandparents but not parents
examples: My cousin and I spent summers together at our grandmother's house
She has twelve cousins on her mother's side of the family

definitions: group or set of twelve things, often used as a standard quantity
examples: Please buy two dozen eggs from the grocery store today
The bakery sells donuts by the dozen at a discounted price

definitions: gradual development of something from simple to more complex form
process by which different kinds of living organisms develop from earlier forms
examples: The evolution of smartphones has dramatically changed how we communicate
We studied the evolution of jazz music throughout the twentieth century
Darwin's theory of evolution explains how species adapt over time
The evolution of birds from dinosaurs took millions of years

definitions: activity of catching fish, either for food or as a recreational sport
examples: We went fishing at the lake and caught several trout
Commercial fishing provides seafood for markets around the world

definitions: feeling of worry, nervousness, or unease about something with an uncertain outcome
examples: Test anxiety prevented her from performing well despite studying thoroughly
Many people experience anxiety when speaking in public for the first time

definitions: person engaged or qualified in a profession requiring special training or skill
examples: The tennis professional gave lessons at the country club every weekend
Medical professionals worked tirelessly during the pandemic to save lives

definitions: chemical element that forms the basis of all organic compounds and life
examples: Carbon atoms form the backbone of organic molecules in living things
The carbon footprint measures the environmental impact of human activities

definitions: short piece of writing on a particular subject expressing the author's views
examples: Students must submit a five-page essay on environmental conservation by Friday
Her personal essay about overcoming adversity won the writing competition

definitions: play for theater, radio, or television presenting a serious story
exciting, emotional, or unexpected series of events or circumstances
examples: The drama won several awards for its powerful portrayal of family conflict
Shakespeare's dramas continue to be performed worldwide after centuries
There was considerable drama when the CEO suddenly resigned yesterday
She always creates unnecessary drama in otherwise simple situations

definitions: person whom one does not know or with whom one is not familiar
examples: A stranger helped her change the flat tire on the highway
Parents teach children not to talk to strangers for safety reasons

definitions: strip of leather or other material worn around the waist to support clothing
continuous band of material used in machinery for transferring motion or power
examples: He wore a black leather belt with his business suit
The designer belt complemented her dress perfectly for the event
The conveyor belt moves packages through the warehouse sorting system
Replace the fan belt if you hear squealing from the engine

definitions: mathematical relationship or rule expressed in symbols showing calculation method
method, statement, or procedure for achieving something, especially reconciling differences
examples: The quadratic formula solves equations with squared variables efficiently
Einstein's famous formula E=mcÂ² relates energy to mass
They found a formula for success through hard work and innovation
The peace talks sought a formula acceptable to both parties

definitions: starchy plant tuber that is a staple food, cooked and eaten as vegetable
examples: Baked potatoes with butter make a simple and satisfying meal
Ireland historically depended on potatoes as their primary food source

definitions: large, ugly, and frightening imaginary creature found in stories and legends
inhumanly cruel or wicked person who commits terrible acts
examples: The children dressed as monsters for Halloween trick-or-treating
Ancient myths often featured monsters that heroes had to defeat
The dictator was a monster who caused suffering to millions
How could such a monster harm innocent children?

definitions: visible suspension of carbon or other particles in air from burning substance
examples: Smoke from the wildfire could be seen for miles around
The smoke detector alerted them to the kitchen fire immediately

definitions: electronic device for transmitting speech over distances using wire or radio signals
examples: The telephone rang just as we were sitting down to dinner
Alexander Graham Bell invented the telephone in eighteen seventy-six

definitions: crime of forcing another person to have sexual intercourse against their will
examples: The survivor bravely testified about the rape in court proceedings
Campus programs educate students about preventing date rape and consent

definitions: inner surface of the hand between the wrist and fingers
tropical tree with unbranched trunk crowned with large fan-shaped leaves
examples: She read his palm and predicted a long, happy life
The magician concealed the coin in the palm of his hand
Coconut palms lined the beach creating a tropical paradise atmosphere
Date palms have provided food in desert regions for thousands of years

definitions: aircraft powered by jet engines capable of high-speed flight
rapid stream of liquid or gas forced out of a small opening
examples: The private jet landed at the small airport outside town
Commercial jets can fly at altitudes above thirty thousand feet
A jet of water shot up from the broken pipe
The fountain features multiple jets creating an elaborate water display

definitions: branch of armed services that conducts military operations at sea
dark blue color resembling naval uniform color
examples: He served in the navy for twenty years before retiring
The navy deployed ships to patrol international waters
She wore a navy suit to the job interview yesterday
Navy blue curtains complemented the room's coastal theme perfectly

definitions: main events of a play, novel, movie, or similar work in sequence
small piece of ground marked out for a purpose such as gardening
secret plan or scheme to accomplish some purpose, especially hostile one
examples: The movie's plot kept audiences guessing until the final scene
Critics praised the novel's intricate plot and character development
They bought a plot of land to build their dream home
Each family tends their own vegetable plot in the community garden
The plot to overthrow the government was discovered by intelligence agencies
Investigators uncovered a plot to steal company secrets

definitions: space between two intersecting lines or surfaces measured in degrees
particular way of approaching or considering an issue or problem
examples: A right angle measures exactly ninety degrees
The carpenter checked the angle with his measuring tool
Let's look at this problem from a different angle
The reporter pursued the story from every possible angle

definitions: person legally held in prison as punishment for crimes or while awaiting trial
examples: The prisoner was released after serving ten years of his sentence
Guards escorted prisoners to the exercise yard for their daily hour

definitions: practice of training people to obey rules using punishment to correct behavior
branch of knowledge, typically one studied in higher education
examples: Military discipline shapes soldiers into an effective fighting force
Parents must balance discipline with love when raising children
Psychology is a discipline that studies human behavior and mental processes
She earned degrees in two different academic disciplines

definitions: discussion aimed at reaching an agreement between parties with different interests
examples: The labor negotiation lasted weeks before both sides reached a compromise
Successful negotiation requires patience, preparation, and good communication skills

definitions: pale yellow edible fatty substance made by churning cream from milk
examples: Spread butter on the warm toast while it's still hot
The recipe calls for unsalted butter at room temperature

definitions: barren area of landscape with little precipitation and hostile living conditions
examples: The Sahara Desert is the largest hot desert in the world
Cacti and other plants adapt to survive in desert conditions

definitions: thing given as a reward to the winner of a competition or contest
examples: She won first prize in the science fair for her innovative project
The lottery prize of ten million dollars changed their lives forever

definitions: projectile for firing from a rifle, revolver, or other small firearm
examples: The forensic team recovered bullet casings from the crime scene
Bulletproof vests protect police officers from gunfire during dangerous operations

definitions: knowledge or perception of a situation, fact, or condition existing around oneself
examples: Environmental awareness has increased significantly among young people recently
The campaign aims to raise awareness about mental health issues

definitions: particular order in which related events, movements, or items follow each other
examples: The DNA sequence determines genetic characteristics of living organisms
Follow the sequence of steps carefully to assemble the furniture correctly

definitions: small round portion of liquid that falls or hangs in spherical form
act or instance of falling or letting something fall
examples: A drop of rain landed on her nose during the walk
Add three drops of vanilla extract to the cake batter
The drop in temperature signaled the arrival of winter weather
Stock prices experienced a sharp drop after the announcement

definitions: collection of things wrapped or tied together for carrying or storing
group of wild animals, especially wolves, living and hunting together
examples: She carried a heavy pack during the mountain hiking expedition
Buy a pack of batteries to keep as spares
The wolf pack hunted together to bring down large prey
A pack of stray dogs roamed the abandoned neighborhood

definitions: person or company that supplies a particular service or commodity to others
examples: Choose an internet provider that offers reliable high-speed connections
Healthcare providers must maintain patient confidentiality at all times

definitions: person who campaigns to bring about political or social change through direct action
examples: The environmental activist organized protests against deforestation
Civil rights activists fought for equality through peaceful demonstrations

definitions: piece of writing in which expression of feelings and ideas uses distinctive style and rhythm
examples: She wrote a beautiful poem about her childhood memories
The class analyzed poems from different literary movements and time periods

definitions: extended period of recreation, especially one spent away from home or traveling
examples: The family took a two-week vacation to Hawaii last summer
Employees receive three weeks of paid vacation after five years

definitions: organized group of criminals or young people who regularly associate together
examples: Police worked to reduce gang violence in the neighborhood
A gang of teenagers vandalized the abandoned building last night

definitions: state of being free from public attention or unauthorized intrusion into personal matters
examples: Internet users worry about privacy when sharing personal information online
The celebrity struggled to maintain privacy despite constant media attention

definitions: mechanical or electrical device for measuring and indicating time with moving hands or digital display
examples: The grandfather clock chimed every hour throughout the day
Set your alarm clock to wake up early for the meeting

definitions: punishment imposed for breaking a law, rule, or contract
examples: The penalty for late payment includes additional fees and interest charges
The referee awarded a penalty kick after the foul occurred

definitions: internal organ in which major part of digestion occurs, being sac between esophagus and intestines
examples: An empty stomach can cause discomfort and loud growling sounds
The doctor examined her stomach for signs of ulcers or disease

definitions: musical performance given in public, typically by several performers or musicians
examples: The rock concert attracted thousands of fans to the stadium
We have tickets for the symphony orchestra concert next Saturday night

definitions: practice or science of collecting and analyzing numerical data in large quantities
examples: Crime statistics showed a decrease in violent offenses last year
Students learned to interpret statistics in their research methods course

definitions: government department or division responsible for specific administrative functions
chest of drawers, typically for storing clothes in a bedroom
examples: The Federal Bureau of Investigation handles domestic security matters
Contact the tourism bureau for maps and local attraction information
She kept her jewelry in the top drawer of the antique bureau
The bedroom bureau matched the other furniture in the set

definitions: wild carnivorous mammal that is the largest member of the dog family
examples: The lone wolf howled at the moon in the wilderness
Wolves hunt in packs to take down large prey like elk
